name: Xavier DUROCHAT
title: Head of Learning , Change & Digital Transformation
summary:
Experienced executive, with solid experience in consulting, coaching and Learning & Development, I have always strived to develop Human Capital, a key player in corporate performance, and to encourage the commitment of employees to make to emerge synergies and added values ​​that will benefit everyone.

Passionate about new technologies, the digital revolution and the place of the human in this transformation, I am convinced that the development of skills and support for change are the key to success of organizations.

Always looking for innovative solutions and problem-solving expert I develop and deploy learning strategies in large organizations, accompanying the development and associated changes.

I defend a realistic and human vision of technology at the service of the company.

My appetites:
• Skills Development Strategy, Enterprise Learning and Organizational Learning
• Pedagogical Innovation (Digital Learning, Content Marketing, Social Learning, Video Learning, Serious Games, IA adapted to Learning (Chatbots, IoT, NLP, Machine Learning, Semantic Analysis, Facial / Vocal Recognition, Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality ...)) and Knowledge Sharing
• Implementation of corporate university and Share Services Center
• Digital transformation (Deployment of a CSR, a Digital Working Policy: Bytes, Bricks & Behaviors, a Digital HR policy, etc.),

I put all my vision, my organizational spirit, my agility, my creativity, my Leadership and my perseverance to answer the challenges of human, organizational or business transformation.

#empowerment #transformation #change  #transversality #managment #coaching  #entrepreneurship #leadership #rh #futureofwork #Digital #innovation #mooc #elearning #digitallearning #spoc #sociallearning #mlearning #learning #learningcompany

name: Arpit Narain, CFA, FRM, CQF
title: Global Head of Financial Solutions - Machine Learning & Quant Modeling
summary:
Arpit is the global head of financial solutions at MathWorks. He is responsible for the worldwide expansion of the firm's financial services business in the areas of Quantitative Modeling and Artificial Intelligence.

He has 13 years of experience in Quantitative Finance and Machine Learning space, where he led large and complex engagements for top investment banks, commercial banks, asset management companies, hedge funds, insurance firms, and regulators across the Americas, Europe, and APAC regions. He also set-up the Quantitative Risk Modeling & Derivatives Valuations practice at KPMG Global Services.

He has deep domain, business, and regulatory expertise across Market Risk, Counterparty Credit Risk, Trading Book Capital, Cross-Asset Derivatives Trading, Derivatives & Fixed Income Pricing, Stress Testing, Risk-based Margin, Asset Liability Management, Model Risk, and AI Governance. 

He has advised large financial institutions including JP Morgan, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, BAML, Deutsche, HSBC, UBS, Credit Suisse, Citi, Barclays, BNP Paribas, Santander, Capital One, SunTrust, MUFG, Fidelity, TD Ameritrade, Oppenheimer, S&P, Prudential, 21st Century, and Bermudan Monetary Authority.

Arpit has excellent technical, business, leadership, sales & business development, and client management skills. He has:

- Deep knowledge of computational and ML methods, financial instruments, regulatory applications, programming (Python, C, SQL, VBA, MATLAB), and tools (Bloomberg, FINCAD, Quantlib, Tableau, etc.)

- Led large projects and advised stakeholders including Sales & Trading, Risk, FO Quants, Investment Management, Capital, IT, Model Validation

- Generated multi-million dollars in sales and led large BD initiatives

- Actively involved in industry events (e.g. member of ISDA FRTB working group, speaker at risk.net Machine Learning, xVA, and FRTB events, speaker at AI and Data Science in Trading Conference, etc)

- Delivered training to the Wall Street banks including Goldman, JP Morgan, BAML, etc on quantitative risk areas
location: New York, New York, United States
duration: 1 year 5 months in role and company
pastRole: Director - Advisory, Quantitative Risk Modeling & Analytics

name: Kim Branson
title: SVP Global Head of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
summary:
I'm passionate about modeling, machine learning and in particular the application of deep learning methods to drug discovery and development

Previously  I've led the development of a general medical inference engine that can be applied to a wide variety of areas, from point of care decision support, triage, insurance risk managment to name a few

 I've  developed software for information theory based design of experiments + qsar methods. This approach drew heavily on Bayesian statistics. 

I've also worked on web scale machine learning and computation for specialized and biomedical web search. I'm interested in statistical natural language processing and large data sets. 

In addition to this i still have an active interest in the development of computational drug design methodologies. My particular areas of expertise and interest include virtual screening and free energy calculations with particular application to the discovery of inhibitors of protein-protein interaction.

Specialties: virtual screening, scoring function design, structural biology, programming (c, c++ , python), docking, ligand based design, statistical language processing, machine learning, biomedical ontology, mapreduce, statistics, bayesian methods, deep learning, pytorch, tensorlfow, CUDA, Fortran
duration: 1 year 8 months in role and company

name: Li Deng
title: Chief AI Officer, and Head of Machine Learning
summary:
Experienced Chief Officer with demonstrated history of leadership in high tech and finance industries. Strong technical, executive management and business development experience; Expert in Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Mathematical/Statistical Modeling, Computer Science, Speech Recognition, Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Neural Nets, Big Data Analytics, & Quantitative Finance.



Brief Bio:
Dr. Li Deng was elected as a Fellow of the National Academy of Engineering of Canada and of Washington State Academy of Sciences in 2019. Since May 2017, He has been the Chief Artificial Intelligence Officer of Citadel. Prior to Citadel, he was the Chief Scientist of AI, Founder of Deep Learning Technology Center, and Partner Research Manager at Microsoft for over 17 years (2000-2017). Prior to Microsoft, he was an Assistant Professor, Tenured Associate and Full Professor (1989-99) at University of Waterloo, Canada, as well as holding teaching/research positions at MIT (Cambridge, 1992-93), ATR (Kyoto, Japan, 1997-98), and HKUST (Hong Kong, 1995). He is a Fellow of the IEEE (2004), Fellow of Acoustical Society of America (1993), & Fellow of the ISCA (2011). Since 2000, Dr. Deng has also been an Affiliate Professor at University of Washington, Seattle.

Dr. Deng was elected to the Board of Governors of IEEE Signal Processing Society, and was Editors-in-Chief of the IEEE Signal Processing Magazine & IEEE/ACM Transactions on Audio, Speech, & Language Processing (2008-2014), for which he was honored with the IEEE SPS Meritorious Service Award. In recognition of his pioneering AI research on disrupting speech recognition using large-scale deep learning, he received the 2015 IEEE SPS Technical Achievement Award for “Outstanding Contributions to Automatic Speech Recognition & Deep Learning”. Dr. Deng was also awarded numerous best paper and patent awards for contributions to AI, machine learning, information retrieval, multimedia signal processing, speech processing/recognition, and human language technology. He is the author/co-author of 6 technical books in several areas of his expertise.
duration: 3 years 4 months in role and company

summary:
I am passionate about people development, culture and leadership, and their various facets - this is my work, and what I like to write about - in fact, I am also a Lynda.com/LinkedIn Learning Author, and an Expert Presenter at conferences.

He also founded an international talent consulting practice that specializes in developing contextual solutions in the domains of learning, talent management, leadership and organization development, and talent acquisition that are both strategic and operational. He is an expert in developing and applying best practices and innovative methods in these disciplines to create effective and scalable programs that engage and enable diverse leadership and employee groups.

For over 20 years he has successfully designed and led regional and global projects for leading companies in the technology, financial and professional services, life sciences, retail (FMCG) and manufacturing sectors: Allianz, Google, Wells Fargo, Ernst & Young, W.L. Gore and Swarovski. He works effectively in complex, global and matrixed organizations.  Jerry has strong intercultural skills, which he developed by working with diverse clients in New York, San Francisco, Munich and Zurich.

Through his coaching and facilitation practice, Jerry has worked with executives, managers and their teams in Fortune 100 companies and entrepreneurs. He is a master coach who has supported hundreds of his individual clients to achieve their goals in the interconnected areas of performance, career and life. As a skilled facilitator, he has enabled numerous teams to perform more effectively in the areas of creativity, collaboration and conflict resolution.

#alwaysbelearnig #staycurious
